comment_text.mn96:2.1: This brahmin appears only here, and there is little to distinguish him personally. A king of the same name features in a Jātaka (Ja 509). Could esukārī be equivalent to ayaskārī, “blacksmith”?
comment_text.mn96:3.1: To “serve” can be to look after, nurse, or care for (AN 5.76:3.5, DN 31:29.2), to offer religious devotions (MN 12:61.2), or even provide sexual favors (Bu Ss 4:1.2.7).
comment_text.mn96:3.4: Manusmṛti 2.238 ff. allows that in abnormal times a brahmin may receive teachings from lower castes, except menials.
comment_text.mn96:4.4: The reference to “these” ascetics and brahmins intrudes here, since none have been mentioned. In the parallel passage at AN 6.57:9.4 it fits, so it may well have come from there.
comment_text.mn96:7.8: The commentary explains (uḷāravaṇṇatā) as “high class”. That may be correct, but normally in Pali it refers to beauty (DN 18:10.1, Ja 458:15.3, Vv 29:1.1).
comment_text.mn96:10.3: Within limits, one from a higher caste may adopt the livelihood of a lower, but not the other way around (Vāsiṣṭha Dharmasūtra 2.22–3).
comment_text.mn96:10.4: “Living on alms” (bhikkhācariya, Sanskrit bhikṣācarya) is acknowledged as the best livelihood for the sages of old at Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 3.5.1, 4.4.22. The later Vāsiṣṭha Dharmasūtra 2.13 says there are six occupations for a brahmin: study, recitation, sacrificing for oneself, or for others, giving, and receiving gifts. Manusmṛti 1.88 is similar.
comment_text.mn96:10.7: Vāsiṣṭha Dharmasūtra 2.16 and 2.18 say aristocrats and peasants share three the same as brahmins—recital, sacrifice, and giving. Their special livelihood is the use of weapons. Manusmṛti 1.89 says more diplomatically “protection of the people” (prajānāṁ rakṣaṇaṁ).
comment_text.mn96:10.10: Vāsiṣṭha Dharmasūtra 2.19 says farming, trade, husbandry, and money-lending. This reflects a more developed economy in this later text. Manusmṛti 1.90 is similar.
comment_text.mn96:10.13: Vāsiṣṭha Dharmasūtra 2.20 says that the only work of a menial is to serve the other castes (teṣāṁ paricaryā). Manusmṛti 1.91 is similar, emphasizing “unbegrudged obedience” (śuśrūṣāmanasūyayā).
comment_text.mn96:12.1: For lokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ as “transcendental teaching”, see SN 20.7:1.6, AN 2.47:1.5, AN 5.79:5.2.
comment_text.mn96:15.2: This is an allusion to the Brahmanical practice of ritual bathing. See MN 7:18.5 and notes there.

root_text.mn96:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.mn96:2.1: Atha kho esukārī brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
root_text.mn96:2.2: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho esukārī brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn96:3.2: brāhmaṇassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti, khattiyassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti, vessassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti, suddassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:3.3: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti:
root_text.mn96:3.4: ‘brāhmaṇo vā brāhmaṇaṁ paricareyya, khattiyo vā brāhmaṇaṁ paricareyya, vesso vā brāhmaṇaṁ paricareyya, suddo vā brāhmaṇaṁ paricareyyā’ti.
root_text.mn96:3.5: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:3.6: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā khattiyassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti:
root_text.mn96:3.7: ‘khattiyo vā khattiyaṁ paricareyya, vesso vā khattiyaṁ paricareyya, suddo vā khattiyaṁ paricareyyā’ti.
root_text.mn96:3.8: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā khattiyassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:3.9: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā vessassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti:
root_text.mn96:3.10: ‘vesso vā vessaṁ paricareyya, suddo vā vessaṁ paricareyyā’ti.
root_text.mn96:3.11: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā vessassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:3.12: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā suddassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti:
root_text.mn96:3.15: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā suddassa pāricariyaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:3.16: Brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, imā catasso pāricariyā paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:4.1: “Kiṁ pana, brāhmaṇa, sabbo loko brāhmaṇānaṁ etadabbhanujānāti: ‘imā catasso pāricariyā paññapentū’”ti?
root_text.mn96:4.3: “Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiyo. Tassa akāmassa bilaṁ olaggeyyuṁ: ‘idaṁ te, ambho purisa, maṁsaṁ khāditabbaṁ, mūlañca anuppadātabban’ti.
root_text.mn96:4.4: Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇā appaṭiññāya tesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ, atha ca panimā catasso pāricariyā paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:5.1: Nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘sabbaṁ paricaritabban’ti vadāmi; nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘sabbaṁ na paricaritabban’ti vadāmi.
root_text.mn96:5.2: Yaṁ hissa, brāhmaṇa, paricarato pāricariyāhetu pāpiyo assa na seyyo, nāhaṁ taṁ ‘paricaritabban’ti vadāmi;
root_text.mn96:5.3: yañca khvāssa, brāhmaṇa, paricarato pāricariyāhetu seyyo assa na pāpiyo tamahaṁ ‘paricaritabban’ti vadāmi.
root_text.mn96:6.2: ‘yaṁ vā te paricarato pāricariyāhetu pāpiyo assa na seyyo, yaṁ vā te paricarato pāricariyāhetu seyyo assa na pāpiyo;
root_text.mn96:6.3: kamettha paricareyyāsī’ti, khattiyopi hi, brāhmaṇa, sammā byākaramāno evaṁ byākareyya:
root_text.mn96:6.4: ‘yañhi me paricarato pāricariyāhetu pāpiyo assa na seyyo, nāhaṁ taṁ paricareyyaṁ; yañca kho me paricarato pāricariyāhetu seyyo assa na pāpiyo tamahaṁ paricareyyan’ti.
root_text.mn96:7.4: ‘yaṁ vā te paricarato pāricariyāhetu pāpiyo assa na seyyo, yaṁ vā te paricarato pāricariyāhetu seyyo assa na pāpiyo;
root_text.mn96:7.5: kamettha paricareyyāsī’ti, suddopi hi, brāhmaṇa, sammā byākaramāno evaṁ byākareyya:
root_text.mn96:7.6: ‘yañhi me paricarato pāricariyāhetu pāpiyo assa na seyyo, nāhaṁ taṁ paricareyyaṁ; yañca kho me paricarato pāricariyāhetu seyyo assa na pāpiyo tamahaṁ paricareyyan’ti.
root_text.mn96:7.7: Nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uccākulīnatā seyyaṁso’ti vadāmi, na panāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uccākulīnatā pāpiyaṁso’ti vadāmi;
root_text.mn96:7.8: nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uḷāravaṇṇatā seyyaṁso’ti vadāmi, na panāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uḷāravaṇṇatā pāpiyaṁso’ti vadāmi;
root_text.mn96:7.9: nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uḷārabhogatā seyyaṁso’ti vadāmi, na panāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘uḷārabhogatā pāpiyaṁso’ti vadāmi.
root_text.mn96:8.1: Uccākulīnopi hi, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, pisuṇāvāco hoti, pharusāvāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti, abhijjhālu hoti, byāpannacitto hoti, micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
root_text.mn96:8.3: Uccākulīnopi hi, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.
root_text.mn96:8.7: uḷārabhogopi hi, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco pāṇātipātī hoti …
root_text.mn96:8.11: Uḷārabhogopi hi, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti.
root_text.mn96:9.1: Nāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘sabbaṁ paricaritabban’ti vadāmi, na panāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ‘sabbaṁ na paricaritabban’ti vadāmi.
root_text.mn96:9.2: Yaṁ hissa, brāhmaṇa, paricarato pāricariyāhetu saddhā vaḍḍhati, sīlaṁ vaḍḍhati, sutaṁ vaḍḍhati, cāgo vaḍḍhati, paññā vaḍḍhati, tamahaṁ ‘paricaritabban’ti vadāmi.
root_text.mn96:9.3: Yaṁ hissa, brāhmaṇa, paricarato pāricariyāhetu na saddhā vaḍḍhati, na sīlaṁ vaḍḍhati, na sutaṁ vaḍḍhati, na cāgo vaḍḍhati, na paññā vaḍḍhati, nāhaṁ taṁ ‘paricaritabban’ti vadāmī”ti.
root_text.mn96:10.1: Evaṁ vutte, esukārī brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn96:10.3: brāhmaṇassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti, khattiyassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti, vessassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti, suddassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:10.4: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti bhikkhācariyaṁ;
root_text.mn96:10.5: bhikkhācariyañca pana brāhmaṇo sandhanaṁ atimaññamāno akiccakārī hoti gopova adinnaṁ ādiyamānoti.
root_text.mn96:10.6: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:10.7: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā khattiyassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti dhanukalāpaṁ;
root_text.mn96:10.8: dhanukalāpañca pana khattiyo sandhanaṁ atimaññamāno akiccakārī hoti gopova adinnaṁ ādiyamānoti.
root_text.mn96:10.9: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā khattiyassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:10.10: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā vessassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti kasigorakkhaṁ;
root_text.mn96:10.11: kasigorakkhañca pana vesso sandhanaṁ atimaññamāno akiccakārī hoti gopova adinnaṁ ādiyamānoti.
root_text.mn96:10.12: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā vessassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:10.13: Tatridaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā suddassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti asitabyābhaṅgiṁ;
root_text.mn96:10.14: asitabyābhaṅgiñca pana suddo sandhanaṁ atimaññamāno akiccakārī hoti gopova adinnaṁ ādiyamānoti.
root_text.mn96:10.15: Idaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā suddassa sandhanaṁ paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:10.16: Brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, imāni cattāri dhanāni paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:11.1: “Kiṁ pana, brāhmaṇa, sabbo loko brāhmaṇānaṁ etadabbhanujānāti: ‘imāni cattāri dhanāni paññapentū’”ti?
root_text.mn96:11.3: “Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiyo. Tassa akāmassa bilaṁ olaggeyyuṁ: ‘idaṁ te, ambho purisa, maṁsaṁ khāditabbaṁ, mūlañca anuppadātabban’ti.
root_text.mn96:11.4: Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇā appaṭiññāya tesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ, atha ca panimāni cattāri dhanāni paññapenti.
root_text.mn96:12.1: Ariyaṁ kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, lokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ purisassa sandhanaṁ paññapemi.
root_text.mn96:12.2: Porāṇaṁ kho panassa mātāpettikaṁ kulavaṁsaṁ anussarato yattha yattheva attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti tena teneva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:12.3: Khattiyakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘khattiyo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.4: brāhmaṇakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘brāhmaṇo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.5: vessakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘vesso’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.6: suddakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘suddo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:12.7: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, yaṁyadeva paccayaṁ paṭicca aggi jalati tena teneva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:12.8: Kaṭṭhañce paṭicca aggi jalati ‘kaṭṭhaggi’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.9: sakalikañce paṭicca aggi jalati ‘sakalikaggi’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.10: tiṇañce paṭicca aggi jalati ‘tiṇaggi’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.11: gomayañce paṭicca aggi jalati ‘gomayaggi’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:12.12: Evameva kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, ariyaṁ lokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ purisassa sandhanaṁ paññapemi.
root_text.mn96:12.13: Porāṇaṁ kho panassa mātāpettikaṁ kulavaṁsaṁ anussarato yattha yattheva attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti tena teneva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:12.14: Khattiyakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘khattiyo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.15: brāhmaṇakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘brāhmaṇo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.16: vessakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘vesso’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati;
root_text.mn96:12.17: suddakule ce attabhāvassa abhinibbatti hoti ‘suddo’tveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
root_text.mn96:13.1: Khattiyakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, abrahmacariyā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:13.2: Brāhmaṇakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:13.3: Vessakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:13.4: Suddakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:14.2: brāhmaṇova nu kho pahoti asmiṁ padese averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāvetuṁ, no khattiyo no vesso no suddo”ti?
root_text.mn96:14.4: Khattiyopi hi, bho gotama, pahoti asmiṁ padese averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāvetuṁ;
root_text.mn96:14.8: sabbepi hi, bho gotama, cattāro vaṇṇā pahonti asmiṁ padese averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāvetun”ti.
root_text.mn96:14.9: “Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, khattiyakulā cepi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:14.12: suddakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:15.2: brāhmaṇova nu kho pahoti sottisināniṁ ādāya nadiṁ gantvā rajojallaṁ pavāhetuṁ, no khattiyo no vesso no suddo”ti?
root_text.mn96:15.4: Khattiyopi hi, bho gotama, pahoti sottisināniṁ ādāya nadiṁ gantvā rajojallaṁ pavāhetuṁ;
root_text.mn96:15.8: sabbepi hi, bho gotama, cattāro vaṇṇā pahonti sottisināniṁ ādāya nadiṁ gantvā rajojallaṁ pavāhetun”ti.
root_text.mn96:15.9: “Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, khattiyakulā cepi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:15.12: suddakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:16.2: idha rājā khattiyo muddhāvasitto nānājaccānaṁ purisānaṁ purisasataṁ sannipāteyya:
root_text.mn96:16.3: ‘āyantu bhonto ye tattha khattiyakulā brāhmaṇakulā rājaññakulā uppannā sākassa vā sālassa vā salaḷassa vā candanassa vā padumakassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggiṁ abhinibbattentu, tejo pātukarontu;
root_text.mn96:16.4: āyantu pana bhonto ye tattha caṇḍālakulā nesādakulā venakulā rathakārakulā pukkusakulā uppannā sāpānadoṇiyā vā sūkaradoṇiyā vā rajakadoṇiyā vā eraṇḍakaṭṭhassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggiṁ abhinibbattentu, tejo pātukarontū’”ti?
root_text.mn96:16.6: yo evaṁ nu kho so khattiyakulā brāhmaṇakulā rājaññakulā uppannehi sākassa vā sālassa vā salaḷassa vā candanassa vā padumakassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggi abhinibbatto tejo pātukato so eva nu khvāssa aggi accimā ceva vaṇṇavā ca pabhassaro ca tena ca sakkā agginā aggikaraṇīyaṁ kātuṁ;
root_text.mn96:16.7: yo pana so caṇḍālakulā nesādakulā venakulā rathakārakulā pukkusakulā uppannehi sāpānadoṇiyā vā sūkaradoṇiyā vā rajakadoṇiyā vā eraṇḍakaṭṭhassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggi abhinibbatto tejo pātukato svāssa aggi na ceva accimā na ca vaṇṇavā na ca pabhassaro na ca tena sakkā agginā aggikaraṇīyaṁ kātun”ti?
root_text.mn96:16.9: Yopi hi so, bho gotama, khattiyakulā brāhmaṇakulā rājaññakulā uppannehi sākassa vā sālassa vā salaḷassa vā candanassa vā padumakassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggi abhinibbatto tejo pātukato svāssa aggi accimā ceva vaṇṇavā ca pabhassaro ca tena ca sakkā agginā aggikaraṇīyaṁ kātuṁ;
root_text.mn96:16.10: yopi so caṇḍālakulā nesādakulā venakulā rathakārakulā pukkusakulā uppannehi sāpānadoṇiyā vā sūkaradoṇiyā vā rajakadoṇiyā vā eraṇḍakaṭṭhassa vā uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya aggi abhinibbatto tejo pātukato svāssa aggi accimā ceva vaṇṇavā ca pabhassaro ca tena ca sakkā agginā aggikaraṇīyaṁ kātuṁ.
root_text.mn96:16.11: Sabbopi hi, bho gotama, aggi accimā ceva vaṇṇavā ca pabhassaro ca sabbenapi sakkā agginā aggikaraṇīyaṁ kātun”ti.
root_text.mn96:16.12: “Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, khattiyakulā cepi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
root_text.mn96:16.15: suddakulā cepi, brāhmaṇa, agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, abrahmacariyā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhi hoti, ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalan”ti.
root_text.mn96:17.1: Evaṁ vutte, esukārī brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn96:17.3: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.

translation_text.mn96:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.mn96:2.1: Then Esukārī the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
translation_text.mn96:2.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:
translation_text.mn96:3.1: “Worthy Gotama, the brahmins prescribe four kinds of service:
translation_text.mn96:3.2: for a brahmin, an aristocrat, a peasant, and a menial.
translation_text.mn96:3.3: This is the service they prescribe for a brahmin:
translation_text.mn96:3.4: ‘A brahmin, an aristocrat, a peasant, and a menial may all serve a brahmin.’
translation_text.mn96:3.6: This is the service they prescribe for an aristocrat:
translation_text.mn96:3.7: ‘An aristocrat, a peasant, and a menial may all serve an aristocrat.’
translation_text.mn96:3.9: This is the service they prescribe for a peasant:
translation_text.mn96:3.10: ‘A peasant or a menial may serve a peasant.’
translation_text.mn96:3.12: This is the service they prescribe for a menial:
translation_text.mn96:3.13: ‘Only a menial may serve a menial.
translation_text.mn96:3.14: For who else will serve a menial?’
translation_text.mn96:3.16: These are the four kinds of service that the brahmins prescribe.
translation_text.mn96:3.17: What do you say about this?”
translation_text.mn96:4.1: “But brahmin, did the whole world authorize the brahmins to prescribe these four kinds of service?”
translation_text.mn96:4.3: “It’s as if they were to force a chop on a poor, penniless person, telling them, ‘Eat this meat and pay for it!’
translation_text.mn96:4.4: In the same way, the brahmins have prescribed these four kinds of service without the consent of those ascetics and brahmins.
translation_text.mn96:5.1: Brahmin, I don’t say that you should serve everyone, nor do I say that you shouldn’t serve anyone.
translation_text.mn96:5.2: I say that you shouldn’t serve someone if serving them makes you worse, not better.
translation_text.mn96:5.3: And I say that you should serve someone if serving them makes you better, not worse.
translation_text.mn96:6.1: If they were to ask an aristocrat this,
translation_text.mn96:6.2: ‘Who should you serve? Someone in whose service you get worse, or someone in whose service you get better?’
translation_text.mn96:6.3: Answering rightly, an aristocrat would say,
translation_text.mn96:6.4: ‘Someone in whose service I get better.’
translation_text.mn96:7.1: If they were to ask a brahmin …
translation_text.mn96:7.4: ‘Who should you serve? Someone in whose service you get worse, or someone in whose service you get better?’
translation_text.mn96:7.5: Answering rightly, a menial would say,
translation_text.mn96:7.6: ‘Someone in whose service I get better.’
translation_text.mn96:7.7: Brahmin, I don’t say that an eminent family makes you a better or worse person.
translation_text.mn96:7.8: I don’t say that being very beautiful makes you a better or worse person.
translation_text.mn96:7.9: I don’t say that being very wealthy makes you a better or worse person.
translation_text.mn96:8.1: For some people from eminent families kill living creatures, steal, and commit sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view.
translation_text.mn96:8.2: That’s why I don’t say that an eminent family makes you an even truer person.
translation_text.mn96:8.3: But some people from eminent families also refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, and committing sexual misconduct. They refrain from using speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re not covetous or malicious, and they have right view.
translation_text.mn96:8.4: That’s why I don’t say that an eminent family makes you a worse person.
translation_text.mn96:8.9: may also behave in the same ways.
translation_text.mn96:8.10: That’s why I don’t say that any of these things makes you a better or worse person.
translation_text.mn96:9.1: Brahmin, I don’t say that you should serve everyone, nor do I say that you shouldn’t serve anyone.
translation_text.mn96:9.2: And I say that you should serve someone if serving them makes you grow in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
translation_text.mn96:9.3: I say that you shouldn’t serve someone if serving them doesn’t make you grow in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.”
translation_text.mn96:10.1: When he had spoken, Esukārī said to him:
translation_text.mn96:10.2: “Worthy Gotama, the brahmins prescribe four kinds of wealth:
translation_text.mn96:10.3: for a brahmin, an aristocrat, a peasant, and a menial.
translation_text.mn96:10.4: The wealth they prescribe for a brahmin is living on alms.
translation_text.mn96:10.5: A brahmin who scorns his own wealth, living on alms, fails in his duty like a guard who steals.
translation_text.mn96:10.7: The wealth they prescribe for an aristocrat is the bow and quiver.
translation_text.mn96:10.8: An aristocrat who scorns his own wealth, the bow and quiver, fails in his duty like a guard who steals.
translation_text.mn96:10.10: The wealth they prescribe for a peasant is farming and animal husbandry.
translation_text.mn96:10.11: A peasant who scorns his own wealth, farming and animal husbandry, fails in his duty like a guard who steals.
translation_text.mn96:10.13: The wealth they prescribe for a menial is the scythe and flail.
translation_text.mn96:10.14: A menial who scorns his own wealth, the scythe and flail, fails in his duty like a guard who steals.
translation_text.mn96:10.16: These are the four kinds of wealth that the brahmins prescribe.
translation_text.mn96:10.17: What do you say about this?”
translation_text.mn96:11.1: “But brahmin, did the whole world authorize the brahmins to prescribe these four kinds of wealth?”
translation_text.mn96:11.3: “It’s as if they were to force a chop on a poor, penniless person, telling them, ‘Eat this meat and pay for it!’
translation_text.mn96:11.4: In the same way, the brahmins have prescribed these four kinds of wealth without the consent of these ascetics and brahmins.
translation_text.mn96:12.1: I declare that a person’s own wealth is the noble, transcendent teaching.
translation_text.mn96:12.2: But they are reckoned by recollecting the traditional family lineage of their mother and father wherever they are incarnated.
translation_text.mn96:12.3: If they incarnate in a family of aristocrats they are reckoned as an aristocrat.
translation_text.mn96:12.4: If they incarnate in a family of brahmins they are reckoned as a brahmin.
translation_text.mn96:12.5: If they incarnate in a family of peasants they are reckoned as a peasant.
translation_text.mn96:12.6: If they incarnate in a family of menials they are reckoned as a menial.
translation_text.mn96:12.7: It’s like fire, which is reckoned according to the very same condition dependent upon which it burns.
translation_text.mn96:12.8: A fire that burns dependent on logs is reckoned as a log fire.
translation_text.mn96:12.9: A fire that burns dependent on twigs is reckoned as a twig fire.
translation_text.mn96:12.10: A fire that burns dependent on grass is reckoned as a grass fire.
translation_text.mn96:12.11: A fire that burns dependent on cow-dung is reckoned as a cow-dung fire.
translation_text.mn96:12.12: In the same way, I declare that a person’s own wealth is the noble, transcendent teaching.
translation_text.mn96:12.13: But they are reckoned by recollecting the traditional family lineage of their mother and father wherever they are incarnated.
translation_text.mn96:13.1: Suppose someone from a family of aristocrats goes forth from the lay life to homelessness. Relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One they refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, and sex. They refrain from using speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re not covetous or malicious, and they have right view. They succeed in the system of the skillful teaching.
translation_text.mn96:13.2: Suppose someone from a family of brahmins …
translation_text.mn96:13.4: menials goes forth from the lay life to homelessness. Relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One … they succeed in the system of the skillful teaching.
translation_text.mn96:14.2: Is only a brahmin capable of developing a heart of love free of enmity and ill will for this region, and not an aristocrat, peasant, or menial?”
translation_text.mn96:14.4: Aristocrats, brahmins, peasants, and menials can all do so.
translation_text.mn96:14.8: For all four classes are capable of developing a heart of love free of enmity and ill will for this region.”
translation_text.mn96:14.9: “In the same way, suppose someone from a family of aristocrats,
translation_text.mn96:14.12: or menials goes forth from the lay life to homelessness. Relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One … they succeed in the system of the skillful teaching.
translation_text.mn96:15.2: Is only a brahmin capable of taking some bathing cleanser, going to the river, and rinsing off dust and dirt, and not an aristocrat, peasant, or menial?”
translation_text.mn96:15.8: All four classes are capable of doing this.”
translation_text.mn96:15.9: “In the same way, suppose someone from a family of aristocrats,
translation_text.mn96:15.12: or menials goes forth from the lay life to homelessness. Relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One … they succeed in the system of the skillful teaching.
translation_text.mn96:16.2: Suppose an anointed aristocratic king were to gather a hundred people born in different classes and say to them:
translation_text.mn96:16.3: ‘Please gentlemen, let anyone here who was born in a family of aristocrats, brahmins, or chieftains take a drill-stick made of teak, sal, frankincense wood, sandalwood, or cherry wood, light a fire and produce heat.
translation_text.mn96:16.4: And let anyone here who was born in a family of corpse-workers, hunters, bamboo-workers, chariot-makers, or scavengers take a drill-stick made from a dog’s drinking trough, a pig’s trough, a dustbin, or castor-oil wood, light a fire and produce heat.’
translation_text.mn96:16.6: Would only the fire produced by the high class people with good quality wood have flames, color, and radiance, and be usable as fire,
translation_text.mn96:16.7: and not the fire produced by the low class people with poor quality wood?”
translation_text.mn96:16.9: The fire produced by the high class people with good quality wood would have flames, color, and radiance, and be usable as fire,
translation_text.mn96:16.10: and so would the fire produced by the low class people with poor quality wood.
translation_text.mn96:16.11: For all fire has flames, color, and radiance, and is usable as fire.”
translation_text.mn96:16.12: “In the same way, suppose someone from a family of aristocrats,
translation_text.mn96:16.15: or menials goes forth from the lay life to homelessness. Relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One they refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, and sex. They refrain from using speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re not covetous or malicious, and they have right view. They succeed in the system of the skillful teaching.”
translation_text.mn96:17.1: When he had spoken, Esukārī said to him,
translation_text.mn96:17.3: From this day forth, may the worthy Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
